org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Simulation.name: USIP OSP Intro
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Simulation.blurb: A simulation just to introduce new authors to the player interface.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Simulation.introduction:
Welcome!

This is a brief sample simulation to show you what a player's world will look like to them. There is nothing to do here other than to investigate this interface. We included several of the frequently used tools here, but normally it is not likely that all of them would appear all at once.

Your First Task
Across the top of your screen, you will notice information such as the name of the simulation, the phase it is in, and your role in this simulation. Also at the top, you should see a set of tabs. Right now you are reading these words on the 'Introduction' tab. These tabs, also referred to as simulation sections, have been defined by the simulation author. These tab headings may change during a simulation providing the players with different things they can see or do. Different players may have completely different set of tab headings.

Please note, that a simulation in action involves the deep involvement of the players. They will interact with the computer, and with each other. The simulation really takes place more in their minds than anywhere else. This interface provides the tools (chat, email, information, web sites, etc.) to allow there simulated reality to be constructed.

Your Next Task
Go to the green 'Check List' tab above. Print it off and use it to record that you have seen all of the different tabs available in this simulation.

Sincerely,
Your USIP OSP Team
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Simulation.learningObjvs: To just show people new to the USIP OSP what the player interface looks like.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Simulation.audience: Anyone who wants a quick glimpse at what the USIP OSP can provide.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Simulation.plannedPlayIdeas: This is just a place for the people new to the platform to look around in it at their leisure.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Simulation.creator: Skip Cole

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.name: Player A
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.public__description: Stuff everyone knows about Player A.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.semi__public__description: Stuff everyone only players close to Player A know.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.private__description: Stuff only Player A knows about themselves: their hidden motives and opinions.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.name: Player B
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.public__description: Stuff everyone knows about Player B.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.semi__public__description: Stuff everyone only players close to Player B know.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.private__description: Stuff only Player B knows about themselves: their hidden motives and opinions.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.name: Control
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.public__description: Control represents the rest of the world to the players.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.Actor.private__description: Control may communicate with the students in many ways: email, chat, injects, announcements, etc.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.SimulationPhase.name: Started
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.SimulationPhase.notes: The first phase of the simulation.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.SimulationPhase.name: Reflection
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.SimulationPhase.notes: A place and time for the players to reflect.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.SimulationPhase.name: Completed
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.SimulationPhase.notes: The last phase of the simulation.

org.usip.osp.communications.InjectGroup.name: General Injects
org.usip.osp.communications.InjectGroup.description: This is a small sample group to help explain that injects can be divided into groups to help the facilitator pick the correct one correctly, during the heat of the moment in a simulation.

org.usip.osp.communications.Inject.inject__notes: These notes generally explain the inject and when it should be used.

org.usip.osp.communications.Inject.inject__text: You can now say, "Now that's something you don't see every day."
org.usip.osp.communications.Inject.inject__notes: These notes generally explain the inject and when it should be used. For example, "Inject 2 should be played only after Inject 1."

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.BaseSimSection.description: A section to see all in game emails, and get and receive emails.
The introductory text will be shown here.
A section to view the player reflections.

An 'after action report' (AAR) is a document written after an event describing what happened and what the lessons learned were. Adding this section to a simulation adds a page showing the after action report that the instructor has written. This is generally considered the essential final step of a simulation: to provide feedback to the players on how they have done, and give them thoughts to reflect upon.
A section to display announcements to the players.
A section to write the after action report.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.bigString:
The 'Schedule' page is actually something that the instructor will write when initiating a simulation. It can say useful things like:

  • This 6 hour simulation will start on Monday 9/6 at 9:00am and run till 5pm, with breaks and lunch during the day.
or
  • This 6 week simulation will begin on Monday 9/6 and be conducted daily. It is assumed that students will enter the system for at least 15 minutes every week night, unless otherwise told differently by their instructor.

Since this is an simulation without any pilot (instructor), and anyone invited to it can go into it at their leisure, we don't really have much need for a schedule here. But we want you to be familiar with this important way that instructors can communicate their personal expectations to their students.
Below are listed alphabetically all of the current Actors that you can see.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.description: A section to allow players see information about themselves, and public information about the other actors in this simulation.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.bigString: In this room you may chat with the actors listed.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.description: A page to allow several actors to communicate privately.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.bigString:
In this small sample simulation we just want to introduce you to a few basic sections that are commonly seen by the players and facilitators. To help guide your reading, you may want to print this page out and check off the following sections below as you see them.

Hint: To complete this checklist, you will either need to login as each of the three players, or log in as Control, who can switch into any of the other players.

Items All Players Can See in the Started Phase
___ Introduction
___ Schedule
___ Announcements
___ Cast
___ Chat
___ Web Links (This is a page where you can add an article/map for all players to reference.)
___ Check List

Additional Items to See in the Started Phase As Control
___ Email Master (On this page the control player can see everyone's email.)
___ Timeline
___ Control (From this tab, you can see enter each of the following pages.)
    ___ Change Phase
    ___ Change Your Role
    ___ Make Announcement
    ___ Push Injects
    ___ Swap/Remove/Add Players
    ___ View Last Logins

Additional Items to See in the Started Phase As Player A/B
___ Background Information (for A/B)
___ Email

(As the Control Player, use the 'Change Phase' page to move the simulation into the 'Reflection' phase.

Items All Players Can See in the Reflection Phase
___ Reflection

Additional Items to see in the Reflection Phase as Control
___ View Player Reflection
___ Write AAR

(As the Control Player, use the 'Change Phase' page to move the simulation into the 'Completed' phase.

Items to see in the Completed Phase as Any Player
___ AAR
On this page you can add a link to a web site that all of the other players can then refer to. These can be maps or articles or any other online resource.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.description: A set of web links, which could be interesting things like google maps, will be presented to the players on this page.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.bigString:
Please reflect on the simulation experience you just had, and answer the following questions:
  • What were you trying to achieve?
  • What strategies did you try?
  • How well did those work?
  • Would do anything different if you played it again?
  • Did anything surprise you?
In this solo simulation, there is not much to reflect upon. But you may try entering in some reflection notes as a player and then viewing them as Control.
org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.description: A section to allow the players to express their impressions, reflect upon their experience, etc.

org.usip.osp.baseobjects.CustomizeableSe.bigString: This is A's Background information. It describes the world from their perspective.
This is B's Background information. It describes the world from their perspective.

org.usip.osp.communications.Conversation.conversationNotes: A place to simulation a forum.

org.usip.osp.communications.Event.eventMsgBody: This is just a sample inject for you to fire. To see its results you and fire it as control, and then log on as Player A or B, and see how they receive it.
